text: Acinos is a genus of ten species of annual and short-lived evergreen perennial woody plants native to southern Europe and western Asia. Its name comes from the Greek word akinos, the name of a small aromatic plant. They are small, tufted, bushy or spreading plants growing to 10â€“45 cm tall. The 2-lipped, tubular flowers are borne on erect sprikes in mid-summer. ==Species== *Acinos alpinus *Acinos arvensis *Acinos corsicus *Acinos rotundifolius *Acinos suaveolens Category:Lamiaceae
title: Acinos
